result.execSummary:
The defendant Jamie L. LeFave was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

FORTHWITH
--serve six months in Jefferson County Jail, with Work Release/Huber privileges; to commence forthwith 
  
--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in his/her system.  Non-compliance will result in loss of Huber/work-release privileges without further process.
--The Court orders Mr. LeFave to comply with DNA sample provision at the Jail

The Court orders entry of a civil judgment for restitution in favor of Amanda M. Ladwig, in the amount of $542.27.

**PER STANDING ORDER 5% and 10% Restitution surcharge added**

[MK] case called at 11:50am. 
Defendant Jamie L. LeFave in court with Attorney Whitney Hagemann.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
ADA Hall verifies victim rights compliance.  
Sentencing arguments given by counsel.
Mr. LeFave makes a statement.

The Court sentences Mr. LeFave to:
--serve six months in Jefferson County Jail, with Work Release/Huber privileges; to commence forthwith 
--1 day credit for time already served given
--pay costs of $243 plus $200 DNA Surcharge plus $10 Drug Diversion Surcharge= $453  to be paid in $30 per month installments commencing on 5/23/17 and on the 23rd day of each month thereafter until paid in full; non-payment shall result in an 8 day jail term with Work/Release Huber privileges, consecutive
The Court orders entry of a civli judgment for restituion in favor of Amanda M. Ladwig, in the amount of $542.27.
The Court orders Mr. LeFave to comply with DNA sample provision at the Jail. 
recess 12:14pm.
Sentencing hearing on January 23, 2017 at 11:15 am.

[MK] case called 11:35am.
Defendant Jamie L. LeFave in court.  DA Susan Happ appear for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court has learned that Defense Attorney Hagemann is delayed in another courtroom. 
The Court indicates to the parties that, once Attorney Hagemann arrives, court staff and the attorneys are to coordinate the rescheduling of the sentencing hearing and Mr. LeFave is to be given notice of that new date/time. 
In response to the Court's inquiry, Mr. LeFave indicates that the 455 W. Blackhawk Drive, Fort Atkinson address is accurate and he is not sure why the Postal Service returned the previous mailing. 
recess 11:36am. 
[Clerk's note: DA Happ filed the Victim Impact Statement before the Court called the case for hearing.]

NEXT:  reschedule Sentencing to 1/23/17 at 11:15am- send notices

With no objection from Atty. Hagemann, the Court allows the victim, Amanda Ladwig to present for the remainder of the proceedings

James Franklin--sworn and testifies

Jury Exits at 12:07pm
recess: 12:07pm--reconvene:12:55pm
The Court summarizes an off the record discussion that the State had no additional witnesses and will now be resting. 
The Defendant chooses not to testify 

Evidence closed at 1:00pm
The Court notes that in review of file, that there has not been an other acts motion filed nor was there any objection to any testimony

Jury Instruction Conference occurs from 1:03 to 2:03pm--Intermittently on and off record
Modified Instruction 275 marked as Trial Exhibit F 

Reconvene at 2:11, with Jury present.
Closing arguments given by ADA Hall (2:12pm-2:22 pm)
Closing arguments given by Attorney Hagemann  (2:22pm-2:28  pm)
Rebuttal Closing arguments given by ADA Hall  (2:28pm-2:30 pm)
The Court instructs the Jury (2:30pm-2:48pm)
Deputy Dennis Griffee is sworn as the Jury Bailiff.

The Jury retires to deliberate at 2:49p.m.
The Court and Counsel discuss providing exhibits to Jury
recess: 2: 51pm--reconvene: 3:49pm


3:51 p.m.: Jury returns with its Verdict.

The Jury finds Mr. LeFave guilty of the charge, Criminal Damage to Property
The Court polls the Jury; their responses confirm the written verdict form.
The Court receives the Verdict, finds Mr. LeFave guilty and orders Judgment of Conviction entered with the single count in the criminal complaint.
Jury Exits at 3:54pm
Atty. Hagemann requests that sentencing be scheduled at a later date 
--no objection from ADA Hall.

The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling.
recess: 3:57pm

NEXT: Sentencing on 1/5/17 at 11:30am

Defendant Jamie L. LeFave in court with Attorney Whitney Hagemann. ADA  Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court so finds.

recess: 2:14 pm
Jury trial on October 27, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Final status/scheduling conference on October 24, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

[MK] case called at 11:55am
Defendant Jamie L. LeFave in court with Attorney Whitney Hagemann.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
In response to the Court's inquiry related to returned-mailings, Mr. LeFave confirms that his address is:  455 W. Blackhawk Drive, Fort Atkinson. 
Mr. LeFave verifies that he knows that the scheduled Jury Trial is on September 22nd at 8:30am. 
The parties verify that they are prepared to proceed to trial this Thursday; counsel agree that one day trial length is sufficient. 
The Court does not intend to carry an additional juror for this trial.  
The Court will allow the jurors to take notes and to ask written questions of the witnesses. 
There has not been any request for individual voir dire or for the Court to ask specific questions of the jury panel.
The Court will have each attorney identify any potential witnesses during voir dire.
recess 12:00pm. 

NEXT:  the Jury Trial remains on the Court's calendar for this Thursday, September 22nd at 8:30am.

[MK] case called at 12:06pm. 
Defendant Jamie L. LeFave in court with Attorney Whitney Hagemann.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court commends counsel for their attentiveness to the Court's Scheduling Order requirements. 
Attorney Hagemann clarifies that she agrees that the subject text --the last of the series of text messages with wording that includes "...don't know what happened but I got marks ..."  falls under the hearsay exception, however the Defense is challenging the statement as not being relevant or probative.
As to this statement, the Court finds that there is no challenge under the Fifth Amendment, Sixth Amendment, Miranda, nor related to voluntariness.  The Court finds that the statement has probative value. The Court overrules the Defense objection, and finds that the statement is otherwise admissible.
Based on the State's lack of objection, the Court grants the Defense Motions in Limine #1, #2, #4, #5.  However the Court indicates that its intent is to caution the jurors with the Special Materials warning at times it deems appropriate, and not "each and every time".  The Court wishes to avoid demeaning the jurors or to have them feel they are not trusted by the Court. 
After hearing arguments on the State's Motion to Impeach with Prior Convictions, the Court finds that the Defendant has eleven prior convictions for Statute 906.09 purposes. 
recess 12:35pm 


NEXT:  the 9/19/16 FSSC and the 9/22/16 Jury Trial remain on the Court's calendar

Case called at 1:15 pm [sf] Commissioner Weber presiding for Branch 2
Defendant Jamie L. LeFave in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Whitney Hagemann Jefferson County Public Defenders Office (PD will appoint counsel). ADA Theresa Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court and counsel discuss procedural posture of the case.
Upon stipulation, the Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, maximum penalties recited
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant. 
Attorney Hagemann advises that the defendant missed court due to moving his mother.
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $2500.00 signature bond, with previous non-monetary conditions: 
--no contact with Amanda Ladwig
--no acts or threats of violence
--maintain absolute sobriety
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores

Recess: 1:23 pm
